bug.author: ming-wei
bug.summary: kernel declaration differs from its actual calling arguments
bug.description: From neon/backends/kernels/ptx/sconv_fprop_K128_N128.ptx, we can see there is a parameter called param_CRST, which I think is supposed to represent C*R*S*T. However, in the actual calling code in neon/backends/convolution.py line 130, the argument is K*R*S*T. Is it a typo or something? I believe the ptx declaration (which is generated from neon/backends/kernel_specs.py) should be param_KRST instead.

comments.comment:
You're right, it should be KRST in kernel_specs. But as it's coded now, those params are never actually used by name. They're just there to generate the signature. Then the kernels are called with the driver api and a packed struct. In bprop, K and C are swapped so it is correct there. Anyway, I'll change it for better consistency. I'll have a brand new set of more flexible direct conv kernels out soon.
